name: Biceps Wall Stretch
setup: Stand next to a wall or door frame
Extend one arm back and place palm flat on wall, fingers pointing behind you
Arm should be at or slightly below shoulder height
steps: Rotate torso slightly away from the wall
Gently lean forward or turn body to increase stretch
Feel stretch through biceps, forearm, and front of shoulder
Breathe deeply and hold for prescribed time
mistakes: Forcing stretch too aggressively (risk of biceps tendon strain)
safety: If biceps or shoulder feel sharp pain, reduce intensity or skip this stretch. Gentle and gradual progression is key.

regressions: Doorway biceps stretch (hand on door frame, less rotation)
Seated biceps stretch (hand behind body on floor)
progressions: Active biceps stretch with band (eccentric resistance)

prescriptionHints.notes: Hold 45-90s per arm. Great post-workout stretch after biceps training.

joints.notes: Be gentle with this stretch—biceps tendon can be sensitive. Avoid hyperextension of elbow.
